UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user's profile information and preferences.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

studyStyle.description: The user's preferred study style (e.g., visual, auditory, kinesthetic).

subjects.description: An array of subjects the user is studying.

id.description: Unique identifier for the study session.

timestamp.description: The date and time the study session started.

duration.description: The duration of the study session in minutes.

subject.description: The subject studied during the session.

topic.description: The specific topic studied during the session.

mood.description: The user's mood during the session.

stressLevel.description: The user's stress level during the session (Low, Moderate, High).

endDate.description: The date the streak ended (if the streak is not active).

streakDays.description: The number of consecutive days in the streak.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability. User profiles and related data (study sessions, streaks) are stored under the `/users/{userId}` path to enforce ownership. The `MotivationalMessage` collection is globally accessible and requires no user-specific authorization.

Authorization Independence is achieved by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. User profiles are stored directly under the `/users/{userId}` path. This eliminates the need to fetch parent document data for authorization. The structure also supports the required QAPs (Rules are not Filters). The segregation of data into user-owned paths (`/users/{userId}/...`) ensures that list operations can be secured efficiently by scoping the query to the user's ID, preventing unauthorized access to other users' data. For the `motivationalMessages` collection, there is no listing limitation since the data is public.
